critique: The document expresses concern for the needy and unemployed, aiming to alleviate their situation through food distribution. It also seeks to improve farm income. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are joy (through improved nutrition and economic conditions) and reduced sadness and fear (related to hunger and unemployment). There might be a hint of surprise at the extent of the problem, but it's not a dominant emotion. Disgust and anger are not really conveyed in the document. The initial scores seem reasonable, but I'll revise them slightly to better reflect the emphasis on joy and the mitigation of negative emotions.
